definition: to let go one's hold/to give up/to have a free hand
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to put one's all into the fight

sentences.english: This hands-off approach could lead to huge risks for the companies.
sentences.chinese: 這種放手不管的作法可能會給公司造成巨大風險。

sentences.english: He released his hand and sat down in the chair, fuming.
sentences.chinese: 他一把放手，氣鼓鼓坐在那張椅子裏。

sentences.english: Use agreed-upon acceptance tests to increase your confidence prior to hand-off.
sentences.chinese: 在放手之前，使用商定的驗收測試來增加您的信心。

sentences.english: The keys to success were that Carnegie Mellon gaudio-videoe us the reins.
sentences.chinese: 我們告成的關鍵是卡內基梅隆大學放手讓我們去幹。

sentences.english: When To Guide, When To Let Go Of Teenagers?
sentences.chinese: 什麼時候去指導，什麼時候放手不管青少年呢？

sentences.english: Finally, it let go5), surrendering to the pull of gravity.
sentences.chinese: 最終，露珠兒屈服於重力的牽引，放手了。

sentences.english: To let go is not to judge, but to allow another to be a human being.
sentences.chinese: 放手，就是不要多加評判，而是允許別人自行其事。

sentences.english: Let children play as they will unless they break their heads.
sentences.chinese: 放手讓孩子玩，摸爬滾打，不頭破血流就可以。

sentences.english: But if you've got guts and a sense of adventure, why not have it out with him?
sentences.chinese: 但是如果你夠膽冒險，爲什麼不放手和他一博？

sentences.english: If you have nothing to lose, you can try everything.
sentences.chinese: 如果你一無所有，反而可以放手去做。

sentences.english: The Chinese government does not care what will happen, you are not alone.
sentences.chinese: 中國不會放手不管，你孤軍奮戰。

sentences.english: Proceed with the knowledge that something much better will be there to replace it if you only let it.
sentences.chinese: 要知道只要你肯放手，還會有更好的替代者。

sentences.english: Let me let go, darlin', won't you.
sentences.chinese: 讓我放手吧，親愛的，求你了。

sentences.english: Go the wrong way to remember to love the wrong person to know how to let go.
sentences.chinese: 走錯了路饌要記得回頭愛錯了人要懂得放手。

sentences.english: We can learn to let go so that what we’re building lives on without us.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以學會放手，這樣即使我們不在生活依舊繼續。

sentences.english: There's no shortage of great ideas and no shortage of people willing to give it a go . . . for a while.
sentences.chinese: 總會有靈光一現的想法和人，在那一刻願意放手一博。

definition: to make a decision when it's time to decide
to let go of sth/to give up
to agree/to consent/to be ready (to do sth)/willing
to get away from/to withdraw/to free oneself
to delegate power/to decentralize
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede

lit. if you have to use force to break a melon off the vine, it won't taste sweet (because it's only when the melon is ripe that it can be removed with just a slight twist) (idiom)/fig. if sth is not meant to be, it's no use trying to force it to happen
pinyin: qiang3 niu3 de5 gua1 bu4 tian2

definition: to concede/to admit defeat
to help sb accomplish his aim/to help sb succeed/to complete/to make whole/to round off
to lay down/to put down/to let go of/to relinquish/to set aside/to lower (the blinds etc)
lit. quick sword cuts through tangled hemp (idiom); decisive action in a complex situation/cutting the Gordian knot
to give up/to abandon/to abort
to accept a compromise
to renounce/to abandon/to give up
to be willing to part with sth
better to just get the pain over with, rather than prolong the agony
pinyin: chang2 tong4 bu4 ru2 duan3 tong4
